channel.title: Comments on: Bing, Google and Yahoo! announce Schema.org
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Benton,

More about itemprop can be found here http://schema.org/docs/gs.html#microdata_itemprop

If for example you want all the itempros for a movie, you would go here http://schema.org/Movie to see what is available

item.title: By: Benton Fitson
item.dc:creator: Benton Fitson
item.description: So is there an authoritative list of 'itemprops' or is this make them up as you go along folksonomy cruft.
item.content:encoded: So is there an authoritative list of ‘itemprops’ or is this make them up as you go along folksonomy cruft.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: xhtml? isn't that dead and now we have html 5?
item.content:encoded: xhtml? isn’t that dead and now we have html 5?

item.title: By: mario
item.dc:creator: mario
item.description: Oh. Haha. That will make the XHTML hipsters cry badly if it's only available via HTML5/SGML markup.
item.content:encoded: Oh. Haha. That will make the XHTML hipsters cry badly if it’s only available via HTML5/SGML markup.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: One image less on a page will even out the extra bandwith from the new html tags
item.content:encoded: One image less on a page will even out the extra bandwith from the new html tags

item.title: By: riverguy
item.dc:creator: riverguy
item.description: It's not as much bandwidth to the end user as it is extra bandwidth to the infrastructure itself. Quite often, adding bloat for a "nice to have" just isn't worth it compared to compact and concise.
item.content:encoded: It’s not as much bandwidth to the end user as it is extra bandwidth to the infrastructure itself. Quite often, adding bloat for a “nice to have” just isn’t worth it compared to compact and concise.

item.title: By: Christiaan Baes (chrissie1)
item.dc:creator: Christiaan Baes (chrissie1)
item.description: not that cheap for mobile internet in Belgium, I think 15€ for 1GB per month not cheap. Normal internet is 35€ for 75GB which won't be a problem.
item.content:encoded: not that cheap for mobile internet in Belgium, I think 15€ for 1GB per month not cheap. Normal internet is 35€ for 75GB which won’t be a problem.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Bandwith is cheap these days....are you still on dialup?
item.content:encoded: Bandwith is cheap these days….are you still on dialup?
